title: Dallas/Fort Worth International Airport Kicks Off 2015 Football Season with Tailgate Party and GUINNESS WORLD RECORDS™ Achievement
text:
DFW International Airport
DFW Airport Sets New Record for "Most Signatures On a Piece of Sports Memorabilia"
DFW AIRPORT, Texas , Sept. 10, 2015 /PRNewswire/ -- Dallas/ Fort Worth International Airport (DFW) has kicked off the 2015 football season by hosting its first-ever tailgate party and breaking a Guinness World Records title on Thursday, September 10 , hours prior to the official start of the 2015 pro football season.
The Guinness World Records for "Most Signatures On a Piece of Sports Memorabilia" was broken at exactly 2:30 p.m. (CST) at DFW's Terminal A with 516 signatures, and a new record was set with 702 signatures on a customized enormous inflated football. The award is DFW Airport's first to be recognized by Guinness World Records, which is the authority on record-breaking achievements around the world. A Guinness World Records adjudicator was on-site to judge and witness the record-breaking event.
The event was held in front of the Dallas Cowboys Club, an exclusive new full-service dining venue in Terminal A, offering travelers an upscale Dallas Cowboys experience featuring advanced Texas -inspired cuisine and a modern-feeling venue.
In addition to breaking the Guinness World Records title, DFW transformed the recently renovated Terminal A into a tailgate party. Tailgate offerings included the world's only Pepsi® Pre-Flight Drills interactive running back/football challenge game, offering tailgaters a one-of-a-kind experience to show off their running back skills for the chance to win a trip to the big game, signed helmets, gift cards, and more. The Pepsi Pre-Flight Drills interactive game will remain stationed inside Terminal A at Gates A12 and B29 making it accessible to travelers now through October 10 .
"We pride ourselves in offering passengers a fun, unique and memorable experience while traveling through DFW Airport ," said Mazhar Butt , senior vice president at DFW Airport . "Our tailgate party to kick off this year's football season, combined with the rare opportunity to be part of breaking a Guinness World Records title, is another example of our commitment to providing an unique and interactive customer experience."
Tailgaters were encouraged to post and share photos on social media using the hashtag, #DFWTailgate.
About Dallas/Fort Worth (DFW) International Airport
Operating on a mission to connect the world, Dallas/Fort Worth International Airport (DFW) is the world's third busiest, hosting 1,850 flights a day and serving more than 62 million customers a year. Located halfway between the cities of Dallas and Fort Worth, Texas , DFW Airport provides nonstop service to 148 domestic and 55 international destinations. A major economic driver for the Dallas/Fort Worth region, DFW Airport generates about $32 billion in economic impact each year. For the latest news, real-time flight information, parking availability, or further details regarding the many services provided at DFW International Airport, visit www.DFWAirport.com or download the Official DFW Airport Mobile App for Apple iOS or Android devices.
(re)defining DFW International Airport
DFW International Airport's $2.69 billion Terminal Renewal and Improvement Program (TRIP) is (re)defining first class for this global gateway. For the latest details regarding TRIP, visit www.DFWAirport.com/Redefine .
